Lexer/Tokenizer¶

What does this do?¶

The lexer or tokenizer (hereby refered to as “the lexer”), will read the given content — usually a file — character by character without backtracking. The lexer detects spaces, seperators, or other key characters to tokenize the content. These tokens are in a array (list), with the token type, the value, and the position(s). The parser will take these tokens next. For more see the Parser page, or Synatax page.

Timeline?¶

  • Day 1: Create a list of token types and definitions. Then start on lexer code.
  • Day 2: Continue working on lexer code and complete it.
  • Day 3: Polish the lexer, fix any bugs.
